toc_entry.title: 1988 Bum Steer Awards
toc_entry.description: A year of clumsy Clements, stupid stickups, ripped-off Rangers, cockeyed cops, agitated alligators, rotund roaches, jumpy judges, nitwit newsmen, addled Aggies, naughty newlyweds, randy retirees, and a pestered pontiff.

toc_entry.title: The Sins Of Walker Railey
toc_entry.description: He had a wife and a girlfriend. His ambition was unchecked. He tried to commit suicide. But when I came face to face with the minister of my boyhood church, the sin we talked about was murder.

toc_entry.title: Ode On A Hempstead Urn
toc_entry.description: That concrete urn you bought by the side of the road is making decorating history.

toc_entry.title: This Land Is My Land
toc_entry.description: Growing up, I took the Panhandle’s plain nature for granted. Only after years away and a sentimental journey home did I take it to heart.

toc_entry.title: Break the Bank!
toc_entry.description: Don Dixon ran Vernon Savings the way the Romans ran orgies, equating excess with success, until his empire collapsed.

toc_entry.title: The Cotton Bowl
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: The ghosts of bowl games past recall an era when cotton and the Cotton Bowl were king in Texas.

toc_entry.title: Not What the Doctor Ordered
toc_entry.subtitle: Education
toc_entry.description: When Houston’s Hermann Hospital sought a cure for its financial ills, it decided to perform major surgery on its agreement with the Ut medical school next door.

toc_entry.title: Sweet Fifteen
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: More than an excuse for a good time, the Mexican quinceañera party is a fifteen-year-old girl’s rite of passage.

toc_entry.title: Chantilly Lace And A Jolly Face
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: When Texas songwriter the Big Bopper died with Buddy Holly and Ritchie Valens in a 1959 plane crash, his hit “Chantilly Lace” became the end rather than the beginning of a national career.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Speaking up for unsung cowgirls; Greeks bearing gripes; Libertarians looking for a landslide.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Down but not out in Bent Tree; dishes only the devil could love; hello, Wal-Mart; stupid napkin tricks; gossip boys and Gorilla Girls.

toc_entry.title: The National Tour Of Texas
toc_entry.description: Our itinerant reporter visits with a Lubbock man determined to preserve the American Way of Life; the doughty clan that brought beer to Levelland; a windy lady fascinated with the weather; and a rusticated professor gone to seed.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Does Texaco have a chance in the U.S. Supreme Court? Dukakis and Gore fight over Texas; a bad start for Kent Hance; the latest Disneyland-comes-to-Texas tale.
